abstract: The board of Riversdale Mining, the Australian coal mining company with operations in southeastern Africa, said Thursday that it backed Rio Tinto’s all-cash offer of $16 a share, some 6 percent higher than Rio’s previous proposal.
snippet: The board of Riversdale Mining, the Australian coal mining company with operations in southeastern Africa, said Thursday that it backed Rio Tinto’s all-cash offer of $16 a share, some 6 percent higher than Rio’s previous proposal.
lead_paragraph: Rio Tinto on Thursday bid 3.9 billion Australian dollars ($3.9 billion) for Riversdale Mining, the coal mining company based in Sydney but focused on southeastern Africa — upping an earlier offer by more than 6 percent.

headline.main: Rio Tinto Offers $3.9 Billion for Riversdale Mining
